item.title: Data Source Identifier
item.definition: Identification of the system from which the data are received
item.remark: Note: - The up-to-date list of SACs is published on the EUROCONTROL Web Site (http://www.eurocontrol.int/asterix).

item.title: Target Report Descriptor
item.definition: Type and characteristics of the data as transmitted by a system.

item.title: Warning/Error Conditions

content.value: Mode C code / Mode S altitude code abnormal value compared to the track
Duplicated or Illegal Mode S Aircraft Address
Undecodable Mode C code / Mode S altitude code

item.definition: Warning/error conditions detected by a system for the target report involved.
item.remark:
Notes:
1. It has to be stressed that a series of one or more W/E conditions can be reported per target report. 2. Data conveyed in this item are of secondary importance, and can generally also be derived from the processing of mandatory items. 3. Definitions can be found in SUR.ET1.ST03.1000-STD-01-01 Radar Sensor Performance Analysis. 4. The coding of Warning/Errors is kept consistent with category 048.

item.title: Position In WGS-84 Coordinates
item.definition: Position of a target in WGS-84 Coordinates.

item.title: Position in Cartesian Coordinates
item.definition: Calculated position in Cartesian Coordinates, in two’s complement representation.

item.title: Mode-2 Code in Octal Representation

content.value: Mode-2 code derived from the reply of the transponder
Smoothed Mode-2 code as provided by a local tracker n

item.definition: Mode-2 code converted into octal representation.

item.title: Mode-1 Code in Octal Representation

content.value: Mode-1 code derived from the reply of the transponder
Smoothed Mode-1 code as provided by a local tracker

item.definition: Mode-1 code converted into octal representation.

item.title: Mode-3/A Code in Octal Representation

content.value: Mode-3/A code derived from the reply of the transponder
Mode-3/A code not extracted during the last update period

item.definition: Mode-3/A code converted into octal representation.
item.remark:
Notes:
1. Bit 15 (G) is set to one when an error correction has been attempted. 2. Bit 16 (V) is normally set to zero, but can exceptionally be set to one to indicate a non-validated Mode-3/A code (e.g. alert condition detected, but new Mode-3/A code not successfully extracted).

item.title: Flight Level in Binary Representation
item.definition: Flight Level (Mode S Altitude) converted into binary two's complement representation.
item.remark:
Notes:
1. When Mode C code / Mode S altitude code is present but not decodable, the “Undecodable Mode C code / Mode S altitude code” Warning/Error should be sent in I020/030. 2. When local tracking is applied and the received Mode S altitude code corresponds to an abnormal value (i.e: the difference in altitude between the current and the previous plot exceeds a predefined system threshold), the “Mode C code / Mode S altitude code abnormal value compared to the track“ Warning/Error should be sent in I020/030. 3. The value shall be within the range described by ICAO Annex 10 4. For Mode S, bit 15 (G) is set to one when an error correction has been attempted.

item.title: Mode C Code
item.definition: Mode-C height in Gray notation as received from the transponder together with the confidence level for each reply bit as provided by a MSSR/Mode-S station.
item.remark:
Notes:
1. For Mode S, bit 31 (G) is set to one when an error correction has been attempted. 2. For Mode S, D1 is also designated as Q, and is used to denote either 25ft or 100ft reporting.

item.title: Geometric Height (WGS-84)
item.definition: Vertical distance between the target and the projection of its position on the earth’s ellipsoid, as defined by WGS84, in two’s complement form.

item.title: Measured Height (Local Cartesian Coordinates)
item.definition: Height above local 2D co-ordinate system in reference to the MLT System Reference Point as defined in item I019/610, in two’s complement form, based on a direct measurement not related to barometric pressure.

item.title: Time of Day
item.definition: Absolute time stamping expressed as UTC.

item.title: Track Number
item.definition: An integer value representing a unique reference to a track record within a particular track file.

item.title: Track Status
item.definition: Status of a track.
item.remark:
Notes:
1. Bit-8 (GHO) is used to signal that the track is suspected to have been generated by a fake target.

item.title: Calculated Track Velocity in Cartesian Coordinates
item.definition: Calculated track velocity expressed in Cartesian Coordinates, in two’s complement representation.

item.title: Calculated Acceleration
item.definition: Calculated Acceleration of the target, in two’s complement form.
item.remark: Notes: 1. Maximum value means "maximum value or above"

item.title: Target Address
item.definition: Target address (ICAO 24-bit address) assigned uniquely to each Target.

item.title: Communications/ACAS Capability and Flight Status

content.value: Comm. A and Comm. B capability
Comm. A, Comm. B and Uplink ELM
Comm. A, Comm. B, Uplink ELM and Downlink ELM
No alert, no SPI, aircraft airborne
No alert, no SPI, aircraft on ground
Alert, no SPI, aircraft on ground
Alert, SPI, aircraft airborne or on ground
No alert, SPI, aircraft airborne or on ground

item.definition: Communications capability of the transponder, capability of the on-board ACAS equipment and flight status.

item.title: Target Identification

content.value: Callsign or registration not downlinked from transponder

item.name: CHR
item.title: Characters 1-8 (coded on 6 Bits each) Defining Target Identification

item.definition: Target (aircraft or vehicle) identification in 8 characters.
item.remark:
Notes:
1. See ICAO document Annex 10, Volume IV, section 3.1.2.9 for the coding rules.

item.title: Mode S MB Data

item.name: MBDATA
item.title: 56-bit Message Conveying Mode S Comm B Message Data

item.name: BDS1
item.title: Comm B Data Buffer Store 1 Address

item.name: BDS2
item.title: Comm B Data Buffer Store 2 Address

item.definition: Mode S Comm B data as extracted from the aircraft transponder.
item.remark:
Notes:
1. For the transmission of BDS20, item I020/245 is used. 2. For the transmission of BDS30, item I020/260 is used.

item.title: ACAS Resolution Advisory Report
item.definition: Currently active Resolution Advisory (RA), if any, generated by the ACAS associated with the transponder transmitting the report and threat identity data.
item.remark:
Notes:
Refer to ICAO Draft SARPs for ACAS for detailed explanations.

item.title: Vehicle Fleet Identification
item.definition: Vehicle fleet identification number.

item.title: Pre-programmed Message

content.value: Work in progress (maintenance, birds scarer, sweepers...)

item.definition: Number related to a pre-programmed message that can be transmitted by a vehicle.

item.title: Contributing Devices

content.value: TU1/RU1 has NOT contributed to the target detection
TU1/RU1 has contributed to the target detection
TU2/RU2 has NOT contributed to the target detection
TU2/RU2 has contributed to the target detection
TU3/RU3 has NOT contributed to the target detection
TU3/RU3 has contributed to the target detection
TU4/RU4 has NOT contributed to the target detection
TU4/RU4 has contributed to the target detection
TU5/RU5 has NOT contributed to the target detection
TU5/RU5 has contributed to the target detection
TU6/RU6 has NOT contributed to the target detection
TU6/RU6 has contributed to the target detection
TU7/RU7 has NOT contributed to the target detection
TU7/RU7 has contributed to the target detection
TU8/RU8 has NOT contributed to the target detection
TU8/RU8 has contributed to the target detection

item.definition: Overview of Receiver Units, which have contributed to the Target Detection.

item.title: Position Accuracy
item.definition: Standard Deviation of Position
item.remark:
Note:
1. There is now a new Item for the Position Accuracy defined in the Reserved Expansion Field (REF), more complete (includes a Standard Deviation of Position in WGS-84) and is based on a different calculation method (covariance instead of correlation). It is recommended to use the new definition. Nevertheless, Item I020/500 is kept in order to prevent a full incompatibility with previous releases of ASTERIX Cat. 020 already implemented.

item.name: RE
item.title: Reserved Expansion Field
item.definition: Expansion

item.name: SP
item.title: Special Purpose Field
item.definition: Special Purpose Field
